data.title: New on DVD: 'Independence Day' sequel, 'Cafe Society,' more
data.meta_description: Here's what's coming out on DVD this week, along with some recent releases.
data.text:
OUT TUESDAY

INDEPENDENCE DAY: RESURGENCE (Fox) In the sequel to the 1996 blockbuster, the aliens are back — and both sides have had 20 years to prepare. With Jeff Goldblum, Jessie T. Usher, Liam Hemsworth. (PG-13; action violence, mayhem, some language)

CAFÉ SOCIETY (Lionsgate) Woody Allen wrote and directed this 1930s-set comedy with Jesse Eisenberg as a Brooklyn kid sent to Hollywood to work with his uncle (Steve Carell), a big-time agent, and finding romance — on both coasts. With Kristen Stewart, Blake Lively. (PG-13; some violence, suggestive material, smoking)

OUR KIND OF TRAITOR (Lionsgate) A vacationing English couple befriend a former money man for the Russian mob, but when he asks them to connect him with British intelligence, intrigue ensues. Thriller based on John le Carre’s novel, with Ewan McGregor, Naomie Harris, Stellan Skarsgård, Damian Lewis. (R; violence, pervasive language, some sexuality, nudity, brief drug use)

ALICE THROUGH THE LOOKING GLASS (Disney) Alice comes back to Wonderland to rescue the Mad Hatter and, literally, turn back Time (played by Sacha Baron Cohen). Produced but not directed by Tim Burton, with Helena Bonham Carter, Johnny Depp, Anne Hathaway. (PG; fantasy action, some language)

THE GOOD NEIGHBOR (Lionsgate) Two high school friends rig their creepy neighbor's house to make him think it's haunted, but discover too late they're messing with a psychopath. With James Caan. (not rated; violence)

GHOST TEAM (The Orchard) A team of losers play ghost hunters in an old barn, and immediately are in over their heads. Comedy with Jon Heder, Justin Long, David Krumholtz. (PG-13; language, drug material)

RAZORS (Breaking Glass) Horror-writer wannabes are stalked by a ghost and the return of Jack the Ripper. (not rated; gore)

COMING SOON

OCT. 21

MORPHINE: JOURNEY OF DREAMS (MVD)

OCT. 25

LIGHTS OUT (Warner), NERVE (Lionsgate), CAPTAIN FANTASTIC (Universal), MR. CHURCH (Lionsgate), PAPA HEMINGWAY IN CUBA (Fox), NORMAN LEAR: JUST ANOTHER VERSION OF YOU (PBS Distribution), BE SOMEBODY (Paramount), MEN & CHICKEN (Drafthouse/MVD), SKIPTRACE (Lionsgate), THE APOSTATE (Breaking Glass), SCHNEIDER VS. BAX (Film Movement), FIGHT VALLEY (Breaking Glass)

NOV. 1

BAD MOMS (Universal), STAR TREK BEYOND (Paramount), CHRISTMAS EVE (Anchor Bay), NINE LIVES (Fox), GLEASON (Sony), ANTHROPOID (Universal), THE SEA OF TREES (Lionsgate), IMPERIUM (Lionsgate), MY BLIND BROTHER (Anchor Bay), BATMAN: RETURN OF THE CAPED CRUSADERS (Warner), MY LITTLE PONY EQUESTRIA GIRLS — LEGEND OF EVERFREE (Shout! Factory), LAST GIRL STANDING (MPI), JUDGE ARCHER (Lionsgate), REIN OF ASSASSINS (Anchor Bay/Weinstein), THE LOST BLADESMAN (Anchor Bay/Weinstein), DAM SHARKS! (Anchor Bay)

RECENTLY RELEASED

THE INFILTRATOR A 1980s federal agent goes deep undercover as a money-laundering businessman to get inside drug kingpin Pablo Escobar’s drug-dealing empire. Based-on-a-true-story drama with Bryan Cranston, John Leguizamo, Diane Kruger, Benjamin Bratt. (R; violence, pervasive language, some sexual content, drug material)

ICE AGE: COLLISION COURSE With a meteor heading for Earth — thanks a lot, Scrat — the characters from the previous four animated “Ice Age” movies head for safer ground, and a new home. With voices by Ray Romano, Queen Latifah, Jennifer Lopez, Denis Leary, John Leguizamo, Keke Palmer, many others. (PG; mild rude humor, some peril)

THE LEGEND OF TARZAN In the latest reboot of Edgar Rice Burroughs’ adventure story, Tarzan, years after having left the jungle for the civilized life in England, is sent back to the Congo, where his special set of skills come back into play. With Alexander Skarsgård as Tarzan, Margot Robbie as Jane; Christoph Waltz, Samuel L. Jackson. (PG-13; violence, some sensuality, brief rude dialogue)

HILLARY'S AMERICA: THE SECRET HISTORY OF THE DEMOCRATIC PARTY Conservative commentator Dinesh D’Souza sets his sights (again) on revealing the dark side of America — namely, he believes, the Democratic Party — with this partisan exposé of the party’s roots and what he sees as its agenda. (PG-13; some violence, thematic elements, smoking)

BLOOD FATHER Action movie with Mel Gibson as an ex-con determined to protect his estranged daughter from a brutal drug cartel. (R; violence, pervasive language, brief drug use)

BREAKING A MONSTER Rockumentary, shown at the 2015 Milwaukee Film Festival, following a metal band called Unlocking the Truth — made up of a trio of African-American teenagers — from playing street performances to opening for Metallica at Coachella. (not rated)

BROKEN VOWS A woman's life unravels after she hooks up with a bartender at her bachelorette party. Thriller with Jaimie Alexander, Wes Bentley, Cam Gigandet. (R; violence, language, some sexuality)

APPROACHING THE UNKNOWN An astronaut (Mark Strong) on a solo mission to Mars travels to the edge of his own sanity. With Luke Wilson, Sanaa Lathan. (R; language)

LES COWBOYS When his daughter disappears, a man living in the countryside of eastern France nearly loses it all trying to find her. With Francois Damiens, John C. Reilly, Finnegan Oldfield. In French and English, with English subtitles. (R; brief violent image, scene of drug use)

LEN & COMPANY Rhys Ifans as an aging rocker-turned-music-producer trying to put his life back together. With Juno Temple, Jack Kilmer. (not rated; sex, language, drug content)

SHERPA Documentary focusing on the Nepalese guides who risk their lives to lead Western climbers up Mount Everest. (not rated)

PHANTOM OF THE THEATRE A theater, haunted by a troupe murdered there in a fire years earlier, gets ready for a new show. Horror movie in Mandarin with English subtitles. (not rated; violence, gore)

SHE WHO MUST BURN The operator of a women's health clinic is targeted by protesters — and worse — when an evangelical family blames her for mysterious deaths in their community. (not rated; violence)

TALES OF POE Horror anthology based on stories by Edgar Allan Poe. (not rated; gore)

THE MISSING INGREDIENT: WHAT IS THE RECIPE FOR SUCCESS? Documentary about a New York City restaurateur who invites the wrath of the dining community when he adopts the design scheme of Gino's, a legendary eatery that recently closed. (not rated)

— Compiled by Chris Foran
